verses.verse: Then answered<WH6030> Bildad<WH1085> the Shuhite<WH7747>, and said<WH559>,
How <WH575> long<WH5704> wilt thou speak<WH4448> these things<WH561>? And how long shall the words of thy mouth<WH6310> be like a mighty<WH3524> wind<WH7307>?
Doth God<WH410> pervert<WH5791> justice<WH4941>? Or doth the Almighty<WH7706> pervert<WH5791> righteousness<WH6664>?
If thy children<WH1121> have sinned<WH2398> against him<WH7971>, And he hath delivered them into the hand of<WH3027> their transgression<WH6588>;
If thou wouldest seek<WH7836> diligently<WH7836> unto God<WH410>, And make thy supplication<WH2603> to the Almighty<WH7706>;
If thou wert pure<WH2134> and upright<WH3477>: Surely now he would awake<WH5782> for thee<WH5116>, And make the habitation of thy righteousness<WH6664> prosperous<WH7999>.
And though thy beginning<WH7225> was small<WH4705>, Yet thy latter end<WH319> would greatly<WH3966> increase<WH7685>.
For inquire<WH7592>, I pray thee<WH7223>, of the former age<WH1755>, And apply<WH3559> thyself to that which their fathers<WH1> have searched out<WH2714>:
(For we are but of yesterday<WH8543>, and know<WH3045> nothing<WH3117>, Because our days upon earth<WH776> are a shadow<WH6738>);
Shall not they teach<WH3384> thee<WH559>, and tell thee<WH3318>, And utter words<WH4405> out of their heart<WH3820>?
Can the rush<WH1573> grow up<WH1342> without mire<WH1207>? Can<WH7685> the flag<WH260> grow<WH7685> without<WH1097> water<WH4325>?
Whilst it is yet in its greenness<WH3>, and not cut down<WH6998>, It withereth<WH3001> before<WH6440> any other herb<WH2682>.
So are the paths<WH734> of all that forget<WH7911> God<WH410>; And the hope<WH8615> of the godless<WH2611> man shall perish<WH6>:
Whose confidence<WH3689> shall break in sunder<WH6990>, And whose trust<WH4009> is a spider<WH5908>'s web<WH1004>.
He shall lean<WH8172> upon his house<WH1004>, but it shall not stand<WH5975>: He shall hold<WH2388> fast thereby<WH6965>, but it shall not endure.
He is green<WH7373> before<WH6440> the sun<WH8121>, And his shoots<WH3127> go forth<WH3318> over his garden<WH1593>.
His roots<WH8328> are wrapped about<WH5440> the stone<WH1530> -heap, He beholdeth<WH2372> the place<WH1004> of stones<WH68>.
If he be destroyed<WH1104> from his place<WH4725>, Then it shall deny<WH3584> him<WH7200>, saying, I have not seen thee.
Behold <WH4885>, this is the joy of his way<WH1870>; And out of the earth<WH6083> shall others<WH312> spring<WH6779>.
Behold <WH410>, God will not cast away<WH3988> a perfect<WH8535> man<WH2388>, Neither will he uphold the evil-doers<WH7489>.
He will yet fill<WH4390> thy mouth<WH6310> with laughter<WH7814>, And thy lips<WH8193> with shouting<WH8643>.
They that hate<WH8130> thee shall be clothed<WH3847> with shame<WH1322>; And the tent<WH168> of the wicked<WH7563> shall be no more<WH369>.
